title: Phase 1: expand core data model
description:
- Introduce Army/Team/Piece/PlayerId enums+structs in a shared types module and ensure they are exported for engine+UI use.
- Redesign Board to store [[u64;6];4], occupancy arrays, throne squares, frozen flags, controller mapping, and promotion zones derived from docs.
- Replace white/black-side assumptions across board constructors and helpers; remove unused default placements.
- Add GameConfig/GameState scaffolding with turn_order, current_turn_index, frozen armies, and dependency hooks for future rules.
notes: Core data model complete. Stalemate test needs better position setup - deferred.

title: Transcribe Golden Dawn array diagrams
description: Source scans (Enochian Chess.html / Zalewski) are not in the repo, so the YAML + Markdown specs still rely on the prototype Tablet of Fire layout. Import or transcribe the canonical diagrams and replace the placeholder board_diagram/piece data.

title: Phase 4: rebuild TUI + input for four armies
description:
- Replace the PGN textbox with the planned 'army: from-to' parser plus command routing to GameState, including promotion syntax and command shortcuts (/arrays, /status, etc.).
- Render four-army board colors/icons, throne markers, frozen status, and turn order indicators in the ratatui layout.
- Surface array selection + new game configuration UI (players, array, mode) and ensure half-block/kitty rendering still works.
- Add integration tests or golden screenshots validating new UI state transitions if feasible.
notes: Replaced the PGN input box with a text parser for army e2-e4 and slash commands, rewired App/UI to show per-army board/status/command results, and kept array selection commands in sync with the documented registry.

title: Phase 0: complete Enochian rule docs
description:
- Flesh out docs/enochian-rules.md and docs/enochian-rules.yaml with structured data from Enochian references, covering board geometry, throne rules, diagonal systems, capture constraints, frozen/exchange flows, and privileged pawn conditions.
- Encode at least one starting array in both prose and YAML, noting remaining TODO arrays per roadmap.
- Document turn order variations, throne coordinates, and piece metadata needed by the engine.
- Update docs/architecture.md with the requested overview diagram narrative plus explicit mapping of all FIDE-only assumptions slated for replacement.

title: Phase 6: rebuild regression tests
description:
- Port the roadmapâ€™s movement + rules fixtures into tests/enoch_moves.rs and tests/enoch_rules.rs using the new GameState APIs.
- Add table-driven queen/bishop/pawn tests covering edges and capture restrictions plus datapacks for promotion zones and forced-king moves.
- Encode Zalewski sample arrays/FEN fixtures under tests/data and wire load/save helpers for reuse.
- Ensure cargo test passes and document how to run the suite in README or CONTRIBUTING as follow-up.

title: Phase 2.5: Move legality + check / stalemate behavior
Phase 2.4: King capture, frozen pieces, throne logic
Privileged pawn promotion fails for Rook and Knight
Extract a machine-readable rules spec for Enochian chess
Fix stalemate test position
description: The test_stalemate_skip_turn test needs a proper board position where the king is NOT in check but has no legal moves (all moves would put it in check). Current position has king in check which is checkmate, not stalemate.

title: Phase 2b: enforce Enochian rule mechanics
description:
- Extend GameState with king_square, frozen flags, throne control, stalemate state, and victory/draw detection fields.
- Implement king capture handling that freezes armies, forced-king-move filtering when in check, and privileged pawn detection/promotion.
- Encode stalemate skipping, frozen blockers (non-attacking), and exchange-of-prisoners hooks per roadmap.
- Add regression tests that cover forced-king moves, frozen army immobility, and privileged promotions.
notes: Added attack detection, forced-king rule helpers, victory/draw checks, and army freezing/throne helpers

title: Phase 2a: implement Enochian pseudo-legal moves
description:
- Replace sliding queen logic with precomputed QUEEN_LEAPS[64] for Alibaba two-step movement.
- Add Aries/Cancer diagonal masks + APIs (e.g., get_diagonal_system) and integrate them into bishop + queen capture filtering per rules.
- Correct pawn direction masks per army, promotion zone detection, and attack masks, ensuring capture legality respects ally/enemy rules.
- Provide unit tests validating queen leaps, diagonal membership, and per-army pawn movement patterns.
